titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Kathleen Hill Family Collection AIA.064
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Rachel Searcy

publicationstmt.publisher: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2014-06-02T11:20-0400

repository.corpname: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

did.abstract: This collection consists of personal family artifacts belonging to Kathleen Hill, including a photo album, travel diary, and publication of The Following of Christ by Thomas a Kempis. The photograph album and travel diary were produced by Kathleen Carmody, Ms. Hill’s grandmother, during a trip made to Europe in 1903. The diary, which contains a narrative of her vacation, also includes drawings, poetry, souvenirs, and postcards. She describes the details of travel, places visited, people met, along with her impressions of the customs and cultural differences.

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This collection contains materials from Kathleen Hill, her grandmother Kathleen Carmody, and her great-grandmother Mary McDonagh.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Kathleen Hill in 2011. The accession number associated with this gift is 2011.050.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright (and related rights to publicity and privacy) to materials in this collection created by Kathleen Hill are held by Kathleen Hill . Permission to publish or reproduce materials to which s/he holds copyright must be secured from the copyright holder. Please contact the Tamiment Library for assistance with contacting Kathleen Hill .

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Materials were rehoused in acid-free folders and boxes.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Kathleen Hill Family Collection; AIA 064; box number; folder number; Archives of Irish America, Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of personal family artifacts belonging to Kathleen Hill, including a photo album, travel diary, and publication of The Following of Christ by Thomas a Kempis. The photograph album and travel diary were produced by Kathleen Carmody, Ms. Hill’s grandmother, during a trip made to Europe in 1903. The diary, which contains a narrative of her vacation, also includes drawings, poetry, souvenirs, and postcards. She describes the details of travel, places visited, people met, along with her impressions of the customs and cultural differences. The collection also contains a theological book belonging to Ms. Hill’s great grandmother, Mary McDonagh, who emigrated from County Roscomman during The Great Famine.

did.unittitle: McDonough, Mary: The Following of Christ: The life of Thomas A Kempis; inscribed inside "Mary McDonough"
